title: Chelsea news: Didier Deschamps plays down N'Golo Kante injury fears
text:
Didier Deschamps as eased Chelsea's fears about N'Golo Kante's latest injury setback.

The tenacious midfielder pulled out of France's Euro 2020 qualifier against Iceland after tweaking his abductor muscle in the warm-up.

But Deschamps does not think the issue is a serious one and Kante should be back available soon.

N'Golo Kante pulled out of the France game due to an injury in the warm-up in Iceland

'I made the decision [to pull him from the squad], because maybe it could get even worse. I knew Moussa would be ready,' he said.

'I do not think it's too serious for Kante, but I do not have an answer about whether he'll play against Turkey.

Clearly Frank Lampard will have been concerned about Kante given his importance to Chelsea and Deschamps also had a slight dig about the Englishman's interference.

The Frenchman should be back sooner rather than later for club and country

Didier Deschamps allayed Chelsea fears over the muscle injury and does not think it is serious

'Lampard had asked me not to pick Kante at the last break,' he told a press conference.

'If that's still the way I'm going to call him later to tell him it would be nice if you play Olivier Giroud a little bit!'

Kante has featured in only half of Chelsea's eight Premier League matches so far this season.

Lampard will hope to have him fit and firing again for the home clash against Newcastle on October 19.
description: Didier Deschamps as eased Chelsea's fears about N'Golo Kante's latest injury setback. The tenacious midfielder pulled out of France's game against Iceland in the warm-up.
